newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE still in CBOT wheat talks but priority low.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE still in CBOT wheat talks but priority low.

text.p: The London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (LIFFE) is still in talks on a wheat contract linkup with Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) but for now the priority was on a planned bond trading CBOT link, LIFFE chief executive Daniel Hodson said.
"We haven't stopped conversations but we are focusing as far as the Board of Trade is concerned on this very important event taking place in May," Hodson said in an interview with Reuters.
LIFFE and the CBOT are due to start a link in May which allows LIFFE to trade CBOT Treasury futures and the CBOT to trade LIFFE Bund futures.
THe London Commodity Exchange (LCE) had been in discussions with the CBOT on a wheat link mainly for the European market but those talks were put on hold when LIFFE and the LCE merged in September.
"Whether we continue that contract and bring on a franchise Board of Trade contract alongside it remains to be seen," Hodson said. "But you shouldn't assume from the silence that the deal is off."
